question: Question 11 In an Entity-Relationship (ER) model, suppose R is a many-to-one relationship from entity set E1 to entity set E2. Assume that E1 and E2 participate totally in R and that the cardinality of E1 is greater than the cardinality of E2. Which one of the following is true about R?
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.A: Every entity in E1 is associated with exactly one entity in E2.
options.B: Some entity in E1 is associated with more than one entity in E2.
options.C: Every entity in E2 is associated with exactly one entity in E1.
options.D: Every entity in E2 is associated with at most one entity in E1.

question: Question 39 In a system, there are three types of resources: E, F and G. Four processes [latex]P_0,P_1,P_2 \; and \; P_3[/latex] execute concurrently. At the outset, the processes have declared their maximum resource requirements using a matrix named Max as given below. For example, Max[[latex]P_2[/latex],F] is the maximum number of instances of F that [latex]P_2[/latex] would require. The number of instances of the resources allocated to the various processes at any given state is given by a matrix named Allocation. Consider a state of the system with the Allocation matrix as shown below, and in which 3 instances of E and 3 instances of F are the only resources available. From the perspective of deadlock avoidance, which one of the following is true?
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.A: The system is in safe state.
options.B: The system is not in safe state, but would be safe if one more instance of E were available
options.C: The system is not in safe state, but would be safe if one more instance of F were available
options.D: The system is not in safe state, but would be safe if one more instance of G were available

question: Question 40 Consider the following solution to the producer-consumer synchronization problem. The shared buffer size is N. Three semaphores empty, full and mutex are defined with respective initial values of 0, N and 1. Semaphore empty denotes the number of available slots in the buffer, for the consumer to read from. Semaphore full denotes the number of available slots in the buffer, for the producer to write to. The placeholder variables, denoted by P, Q, R, and S, in the code below can be assigned either empty or full . The valid semaphore operations are: wait() and signal() . Which one of the following assignments to P, Q, R and S will yield the correct solution?
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.A: P: full, Q: full, R: empty, S: empty
options.B: P: empty, Q: empty, R: full, S: full
options.C: P: full, Q: empty, R: empty, S: full
options.D: P: empty, Q: full, R: full, S: empty

) denotes the probability of Guwahati having medium and low temperatures respectively. Similarly, we use P([latex]H_{D}[/latex]),P([latex]M_{D}[/latex]) and P([latex]L_{D}[/latex]) for Delhi. The first entry denotes that if Guwahati has high
temperature ([latex]H_{G}[/latex]) then the probability of Delhi also having a high temperature ([latex]H_{D}[/latex]) is 0.40;

P([latex]L_{D}[/latex]|[latex]H_{G}[/latex]) = 0.12. Similarly for the other rows.
If it is known that P([latex]H_{G}[/latex])= 0.2, P([latex]M_{G}[/latex])= 0.5, andP([latex]L_{G}[/latex])= 0.3, then the probability

Question 55 Consider a simple communication system where multiple nodes are connected by a shared broadcast medium (like Ethernet or wireless). The nodes in the system use the following carrier-sense based medium access protocol. A node that receives a packet to transmit will carrier-sense the medium for 5 units of time. If the node does not detect any other transmission in this duration, it starts transmitting its packet in the next time unit. If the node detects another transmission, it waits until this other transmission finishes, and then begins to carrier-sense for 5 time units again. Once they start to transmit, nodes do not perform any collision detection and continue transmission even if a collision occurs. All transmissions last for 20 units of time. Assume that the transmission signal travels at the speed of 10 meters per unit time in the medium. Assume that the system has two nodes P and Q, located at a distance d meters from each other. P starts transmitting a packet at time t=0 after successfully completing its carrier-sense phase. Node Q has a packet to transmit at time t=0 and begins to carrier-sense the medium. successfully avoid a collision between its proposed transmission and P's ongoing
transmission is _____.
